snippet: Although New Mexico’s Supreme Court has not ruled that gay marriage is allowed in the state, the clerk said he had exhausted his patience waiting for a resolution.
abstract: Lynn Ellins, county clerk in New Mexico, begins issuing marriage licenses to same-sex couples, saying he is upholding the state's Constitution; says he has exhausted his patience waiting for courts to resolve ambiguity between the state's definition of marriage and state's marriage applications.

byline.original: By HEATH HAUSSAMEN and FERNANDA SANTOS
byline.contributor: Heath Haussamen reported from Las Cruces, and Fernanda Santos from Phoenix.

lead_paragraph: Although New Mexico’s Supreme Court has not ruled that gay marriage is allowed in the state, the clerk said he had exhausted his patience waiting for a resolution.

headline.main: County Clerk in New Mexico Issues Marriage Licenses to Same-Sex Couples
headline.print_headline: County Clerk in New Mexico Issues Marriage Licenses to Same-Sex Couples

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
